summary: A brief email from Max Nicholas (USANYS) to an unnamed recipient, forwarding three document references (EFTA00105648, EFTA00105649, EFTA00105650) with the subject line 'True bill! TB! Thanks for handling!' The email appears to be a communication about a legal matter, possibly related to a grand jury indictment.

persons.name: Max Nicholas
persons.role: US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) employee
persons.context: Sender of an email forwarding document references with the subject 'True bill! TB! Thanks for handling!'

events.title: Email regarding 'True bill'
events.description: Max Nicholas sends an email with the subject 'True bill! TB! Thanks for handling!' forwarding three document references.

keyFacts: The email subject 'True bill! TB!' strongly suggests communication about a grand jury indictment ('true bill' is a term for a grand jury's decision to indict).
The email forwards three specific document references: EFTA00105648, EFTA00105649, and EFTA00105650.
The sender is identified as 'Max Nicholas (USANYS)', indicating he is part of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The correspondence is dated February 23-24, 2018, which is prior to Jeffrey Epstein's July 2019 arrest by the SDNY.
